questions.question_text: The Cisco DNA Center Sites API must be used to add a device to a site, but only the site name is available. Which API call must be used to retrieve the site identifier so that the device can be properly added to the network?

discussion.content: Answer is C, B is to use DNAC API's

Selected Answer: C
Basic ITSM CMDB Synchronization: 
***Deals with syncing ITSM CMDB data, not event notifications.

DNA Center Rest API: 
***General access to DNA Center's features, not specifically for notifications.

Network Issue Monitor and Enrichment for ITSM: 
***Monitors issues and enriches ITSM data, not focused on real-time notifications.

Network Events for REST API Endpoint:
***facilitates the real-time or near-real-time visualization of network-related data and events

Selected Answer: C
C - Network Events for REST API Endpoint

choices.C: Network Events for REST API Endpoint
choices.D: Network Issue Monitor and Enrichment for ITSM

questions.question_text: When a Grafana dashboard is built to receive network events from Cisco DNA Center, which integration bundle is enabled to send notifications?
Which field must be completed in Cisco DNA Center when a network discovery is initiated?
Webhooks that are generated by Cisco DNA Center are REST calls with which properties?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct because Cisco DNA Center webhooks use the POST method to deliver JSON payloads for event notifications.

A is incorrect because the PUT method is typically used for updating resources, not for sending notifications like webhooks, which generally use POST.

Answer is C, if this is for old version of Cisco DNAC
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!cisco-dna-center-releases-1-2-5-x-1-3-0-x/event-notification-via-webhooks-125-130x

For newer version, it could be either A or C
https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!cisco-dna-center-release-1-3-1/cisco-dna-center---releases-131---event-management

I'll go with C, as this is correct for both older and newer version/release.

Selected Answer: CE
ChatGPT says its C and E

Selected Answer: CE
Very easy to test, why does everyone answer A and D? Use the cisco devnet sandbox. 
Correct answer is C y D. Even B works but in the question it clearly says only one team

Selected Answer: AD
According to this page: https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/2-3-5/sync-devices/

Operation Id: syncDevices
Description: Sync the devices provided as input

curl -L --request PUT \
--url /dna/intent/api/v1/network-device \
--header 'Accept: application/json' \
--header 'Content-Type: ' \
--data '{ "type": "COMPUTE_DEVICE" }'

AND

Operation Id: syncDevicesNetworkDevice
Description: Synchronizes the devices. If forceSync param is false (default) then the sync would run in normal priority thread. If forceSync param is true then the sync would run in high priority thread if available, else the sync will fail. Result can be seen in the child task of each device.

curl -L --request PUT \
--url /dna/intent/api/v1/network-device/sync \
--header 'Accept: application/json' \
--header 'Content-Type: ' \
--data '{}'

All the best.

Selected Answer: AD
Definitely A & D:

A - https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!update-device-details (note the end of the description: 
"Description: Update the credentials, management IP address of a given device (or a set of devices) in Cisco DNA Center and trigger an inventory sync."

D - https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!sync-devices

Answer is A and D
A - https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!add-device-1
D - https://developer.cisco.com/docs/dna-center/#!sync-devices-2

questions.question_text: Which two API calls are used to trigger a device configuration sync in Cisco DNA Center? (Choose two.)
